SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class InsertBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.InsertBuilder
public final class InsertBuilder extends Object
A Builder class for SQLInsert instances.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public InsertBuilder of(Class<?> clazz)
      Sets the type of the beans to be persisted. May be a record type.
      Parameters:
      clazz - the type of the beans to be persisted
      Returns:
      this SQLInsertBuilder

    • into

      public InsertBuilder into(String tableName)
      Sets the table name to insert the data into. If not specified, this defaults to the simple name of the bean or record class, mapped using SessionConfig.getPropertyToColumnMapper().
      Parameters:
      tableName - the table name to insert the data into
      Returns:
      this SQLInsertBuilder

    • excluding

      public InsertBuilder excluding(String... properties)
      Sets the properties (and corresponding columns) to exclude from the INSERT statement. You would most likely at least want to exclude the property corresponding to the auto-generated key column. It is not allowed to call this method more than once, or to call both this method and the including(String...) method.
      Parameters:
      properties - the properties (and corresponding columns) to exclude from the INSERT statement
      Returns:
      this SQLInsertBuilder

    • including

      public InsertBuilder including(String... properties)
      Sets the properties (and corresponding columns) to include in the INSERT statement. It is not allowed to call this method more than once, or to call both this method and the excluding(String...) method.
      Parameters:
      properties - the properties (and corresponding columns) to include in the INSERT statement
      Returns:
      this SQLInsertBuilder

    • retrieveKeys

      public InsertBuilder retrieveKeys(boolean b)
      Specifies whether auto-generated keys should be retrieved from the database. By default this is the case. Therefore, if the INSERT statement does not cause any keys to be generated by the database, do call this method to disable this feature. Otherwise the JDBC driver may throw an SQLException.
      Parameters:
      b - whether auto-generated keys should be retrieved from the database
      Returns:
      this SQLInsertBuilder

    • withConfig

      public InsertBuilder withConfig(SessionConfig config)
      Sets the SessionConfig object to be used to fine-tune the INSERT. Defaults to SessionConfig.getDefaultConfig().
      Parameters:
      config - the SessionConfig object to be used to fine-tune the INSERT
      Returns:
      this SQLInsertBuilder

    • prepare

      public SQLInsert prepare(Connection con)
      Returns an SQLInsert instance that allows you to execute the INSERT statement.
      Parameters:
      con - the JDBC Connection to use for the INSERT statement
      Returns:
      a SQLInsert instance that allows you to execute the INSERT statement
